required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of DSXS in Patients With Mild to Moderate Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Design, Multiple-Site Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of DSXS in Patients With Mild to Moderate Plaque Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of DSXS compared to a Placebo (vehicle) in patients with mild to moderate plaque psoriasis.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of dsxs topical spray, 0.15% (Taro Pharmaceuticals, U.S.A., Inc.) compared to a Placebo (vehicle) spray (Taro Pharmaceuticals, U.S.A., Inc.) in patients with mild to moderate plaque psoriasis.

study_design_info.masking: Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor

primary_outcome.measure: the proportion of patients in each treatment group that have clinical success
primary_outcome.description: the proportion of patients in each treatment group that have clinical success (Clinical Success is at least a 2-grade improvement from the baseline IGA score, i.e. 0 or 1)

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients in each treatment group that have Treatment Success for the Target Lesion
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients in each treatment group that have Treatment Success for the Target Lesion (Treatment Success for the Target Lesion (a score of 0 or 1 for each of the three signs and symptoms (i.e., erythema, scaling and plaque elevation))

arm_group.description: To evaluate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of DSXS topical spray, 0.15%.
Eligible patients will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to Test or Placebo product.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male and non-pregnant females, 12 years of age or older, with a confirmed diagnosis of mild to moderate plaque psoriasis
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient is< 12 years old.
